gitlab-data-source-project.body:
data "gitlab_project" "$1" {
    # id - (Required) The integer that uniquely identifies the project within the gitlab install.
    id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "path" - The path of the repository.
    # "namespace_id" - The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user. See ["gitlab_group"](../r/group.html) for an example.
    # "description" - A description of the project.
    # "default_branch" - The default branch for the project.
    # "issues_enabled" - Enable issue tracking for the project.
    # "merge_requests_enabled" - Enable merge requests for the project.
    # "wiki_enabled" - Enable wiki for the project.
    # "snippets_enabled" - Enable snippets for the project.
    # "visibility_level" -  Repositories are created as private by default.
    # "id" - Integer that uniquely identifies the project within the gitlab install.
    # "ssh_url_to_repo" - URL that can be provided to "git clone" to clone the repository via SSH.
    # "http_url_to_repo" - URL that can be provided to "git clone" to clone the repository via HTTP.
    # "web_url" - URL that can be used to find the project in a browser.
}
gitlab-data-source-project.description: Provides details about a specific project in the gitlab provider. The results include the name of the project, path, description, default branch, etc.

gitlab-data-source-user.body:
data "gitlab_user" "$1" {
    # email - (Optional) The e-mail address of the user. (Requires administrator privileges)
    email = ""

    # username - (Optional) The username of the user.
    username = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" - The name of the user.
    # "username" - The username of the user.
    # "email" - The e-mail address of the user.
    # "id" - The unique id assigned to the user by the gitlab server.
}
gitlab-data-source-user.description: Provides details about a specific user in the gitlab provider. Especially the ability to lookup the id for linking to other resources.

gitlab-resource-deploy_key.body:
resource "gitlab_deploy_key" "$1" {
    # project - (Optional) (Required, string) The name or id of the project to add the deploy key to.
    project = ""

    # title - (Optional) (Required, string) A title to describe the deploy key with.
    title = ""

    # key - (Optional) (Required, string) The public ssh key body.
    key = ""

    # can_push - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) Allow this deploy key to be used to push changes to the project.  Defaults to `false`. **NOTE::** this cannot currently be managed.
    can_push = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
gitlab-resource-deploy_key.description: This resource allows you to create and manage deploy keys for your GitLab projects.

gitlab-resource-group.body:
resource "gitlab_group" "$1" {
    # path - (Required) The path of the group.
    path = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of this group.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the group.
    description = ""

    # lfs_enabled - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to true.  Whether to enable LFS support for projects in this group.
    lfs_enabled = ""

    # request_access_enabled - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to false.  Whether to enable users to request access to the group.
    request_access_enabled = ""

    # visibility_level - (Optional) Set to `public` to create a public group. Valid values are `private`, `internal`, `public`. Groups are created as private by default.
    visibility_level = ""

    # parent_id - (Optional) Integer, id of the parent group (creates a nested group).
    parent_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The unique id assigned to the group by the GitLab server.  Serves as a
    # "parent_id" - (Optional) Integer, id of the parent group (creates a nested group).
}
gitlab-resource-group.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab groups.
Note your provider will need to be configured with admin-level access for this resource to work.

gitlab-resource-group-variable.body:
resource "gitlab_group_variable" "$1" {
    # group - (Optional) (Required, string) The name or id of the group to add the hook to.
    group = ""

    # key - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the variable.
    key = ""

    # value - (Optional) (Required, string) The value of the variable.
    value = ""

    # protected - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.
    protected = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
gitlab-resource-group-variable.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab groups.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/ci/variables/README.html#variables).

gitlab-resource-group_membership.body:
resource "gitlab_group_membership" "$1" {
    # access_level - (Required)  Acceptable values are: guest, reporter, developer, master.
    access_level = ""

    # user_id - (Required) The id of the user.
    user_id = ""

    # group_id - (Required) The id of the group.
    group_id = ""

    # expires_at - (Optional) Expiration date for the group membership. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`
    expires_at = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
gitlab-resource-group_membership.description: This resource allows you to add a user to an existing group.

gitlab-resource-label.body:
resource "gitlab_label" "$1" {
    # color - (Required) The color of the label given in 6-digit hex notation with leading '#' sign (e.g. #FFAABB) or one of the [CSS color names](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#Color_keywords).
    color = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the label.
    name = ""

    # project - (Required) The name or id of the project to add the label to.
    project = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the label.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The unique id assigned to the label by the GitLab server (the name of the label).
    # "description" - (Optional) The description of the label.
}
gitlab-resource-label.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage labels for your GitLab projects.
For further information on labels, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/labels.htm).

gitlab-resource-project-hook.body:
resource "gitlab_project_hook" "$1" {
    # url - (Required) The url of the hook to invoke.
    url = ""

    # project - (Required) The name or id of the project to add the hook to.
    project = ""

    # token - (Optional) A token to present when invoking the hook.
    token = ""

    # enable_ssl_verification - (Optional) Enable ssl verification when invoking the hook.
    enable_ssl_verification = ""

    # push_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for push events.
    push_events = ""

    # issues_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for issues events.
    issues_events = ""

    # merge_requests_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for merge requests.
    merge_requests_events = ""

    # tag_push_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for tag push events.
    tag_push_events = ""

    # note_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for notes events.
    note_events = ""

    # job_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for job events.
    job_events = ""

    # pipeline_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for pipeline events.
    pipeline_events = ""

    # wiki_page_events - (Optional) Invoke the hook for wiki page events.
    wiki_page_events = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The unique id assigned to the hook by the GitLab server.
    # "wiki_page_events" - (Optional) Invoke the hook for wiki page events.
}
gitlab-resource-project-hook.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage hooks for your GitLab projects.
For further information on hooks, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/integrations/webhooks.html).

gitlab-resource-project-variable.body:
resource "gitlab_project_variable" "$1" {
    # project - (Optional) (Required, string) The name or id of the project to add the hook to.
    project = ""

    # key - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the variable.
    key = ""

    # value - (Optional) (Required, string) The value of the variable.
    value = ""

    # protected - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.
    protected = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
gitlab-resource-project-variable.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab projects.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/ci/variables/README.html#variables).

gitlab-resource-project-x.body:
resource "gitlab_project" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the project.
    name = ""

    # path - (Optional) The path of the repository.
    path = ""

    # namespace_id - (Optional) The namespace (group or user) of the project. Defaults to your user. See [`gitlab_group`](group.html) for an example.
    namespace_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the project.
    description = ""

    # default_branch - (Optional) The default branch for the project.
    default_branch = ""

    # issues_enabled - (Optional) Enable issue tracking for the project.
    issues_enabled = ""

    # merge_requests_enabled - (Optional) Enable merge requests for the project.
    merge_requests_enabled = ""

    # wiki_enabled - (Optional) Enable wiki for the project.
    wiki_enabled = ""

    # snippets_enabled - (Optional) Enable snippets for the project.
    snippets_enabled = ""

    # visibility_level - (Optional) Set to `public` to create a public project. Valid values are `private`, `internal`, `public`. Repositories are created as private by default.
    visibility_level = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - Integer that uniquely identifies the project within the gitlab install.
    # "ssh_url_to_repo" - URL that can be provided to "git clone" to clone the repository via SSH.
    # "http_url_to_repo" - URL that can be provided to "git clone" to clone the repository via HTTP.
    # "web_url" - URL that can be used to find the project in a browser.
}
gitlab-resource-project-x.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage projects within your
GitLab group or within your user.

gitlab-resource-project_membership.body:
resource "gitlab_project_membership" "$1" {
    # access_level - (Required) One of five levels of access to the project.
    access_level = ""

    # user_id - (Required) The id of the user.
    user_id = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the project.
    project_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
gitlab-resource-project_membership.description: This resource allows you to add a current user to an existing project with a set access level.

gitlab-resource-user.body:
resource "gitlab_user" "$1" {
    # email - (Required) The e-mail address of the user.
    email = ""

    # password - (Required) The password of the user.
    password = ""

    # username - (Required) The username of the user.
    username = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the user.
    name = ""

    # is_admin - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to false.  Whether to enable administrative priviledges for the user.
    is_admin = ""

    # projects_limit - (Optional) Integer, defaults to 0.  Number of projects user can create.
    projects_limit = ""

    # can_create_group - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to false. Whether to allow the user to create groups.
    can_create_group = ""

    # skip_confirmation - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to true. Whether to skip confirmation.
    skip_confirmation = ""

    # is_external - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to false. Whether a user has access only to some internal or private projects. External users can only access projects to which they are explicitly granted access.
    is_external = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The unique id assigned to the user by the GitLab server.
    # "is_external" - (Optional) Boolean, defaults to false. Whether a user has access only to some internal or private projects. External users can only access projects to which they are explicitly granted access.
}
gitlab-resource-user.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage GitLab users.
Note your provider will need to be configured with admin-level access for this resource to work.
